passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 80.00 CHF | Price: 69.65 CHF

Growth stronger for longer despite short term tariff hitAt H1'25 results, Accelleron reiterated its FY25 growth target but lowered its margin guidance by 1%. The guidance cut was driven by higher US tariffs on Swiss imports (39%), but mitigation measures are expected to reverse the impact in 2026. As a result, we lower our 25 EBITA estimates by 4%. In the mid-term, we see growth trajectory to remain solid driven by data centre demand (c20% p.a. for OE) and good visibility on marine backlog (c3.5 years). We therefore raise our sales growth estimates to 19% 25e/11% 26e/10% 27e and raised our EBITA estimates by 3% 26e/9% 27e. Given the 2x EBIT margin vs sector and mid-term sustainable growth, we now apply a 24x EV/EBITA multiple on 2027e EV/EBITA (previously 23x 26e). Our PO is now CHF80 (from CH 70), reiterate Buy rating.

In H1'25, Accelleron benefitted from market share gains in retrofit, which enables higher energy efficiency in low- speed engines. We expect the growth momentum to continue in marine 2025- 2027 due to 1) higher demand in retrofit given potential tighter IMO regulation, 2) OE growth in 2024/2025 could translate into service growth in 2026 and beyond. We now expect \(\sim 19\%\) revenue growth in 2025e and \(\sim 11\%\) revenue growth in 2026e, at the higher end of current FY25 growth guidance (16- 19%).

In the Energy end market, high speed turbocharger units sold tripled in 2025 vs 2024, driven by demand in data centre back up power. We see continued strong momentum in data centre back up power generation and expect Accelleron to continue to gain market shares in an OE market growing c20% p.a. As a result, we expect high speed organic growth to be at c18% in 2025 and 15% in 2026.

We see Accelleron's strong growth momentum to continue into H2'25 and 2026 driven by long shipyard backlog, growing demand and market share in marine retrofit and data centre backup power. As a result, we expect higher growth and profitability to extend into the midterm and our 26/27e revenue/EBITA are 7%10% above consensus estimates.

Our price objective of CHF80 per share is based on applying multiple of 24x 2027E EV/EBITA against our EBITA estimates, adjusted against the current forward curve and discount back to 2026. The 24x multiple is driven by Accelleron's 2x EBIT margin (25- 26%) vs sector at (13%) with above sector growth in the medium term.

Upside risks are: faster- than- expected development and adoption rates of new, high- performance, efficient turbochargers (including for green fuels) in the marine and energy markets, faster growth within the service business, faster gain of market share in High Speed diesel, synergies from M&A.

Downside risks are: the company's significant exposure to marine and particularly container shipping (currently seeing a down- cycle), high customer concentration, gas prices affecting demand in gas applications, service market share erosion from original equipment manufacturers (OEMs), inefficient M&A.
